cards.title: Re:Divider
cards.description: A puzzle game made for GGJ 2022

mainRoles.description: Implemented main player movement and game manager systems, including storing a level's state, manipulating time, verifying completion
Assisted artists in asset animation, UI setup and cloud shaders

cards.platform: Web-based Puzzle Game made in Unity
cards.longDescription: Re:Divider is a multiplayer puzzle game about two characters who are trapped in parallel worlds - one where time flow is reversed! Help our two characters meet by manipulating their worlds to the exact same state and bring their worlds together.

cards.title: Marley
cards.description: A heartfelt VR game about caring for your grandma as her dog Marley

mainRoles.description: Created object pickup and placement interactions with the dog's snout to increase player's immersion
Implemented system for fetch quests and story progression

cards.platform: Oculus Quest VR Game made in Unity
cards.longDescription:
Marley is an emotional story-based game played from the perspective of a dog (Marley) taking care of their elder owner. The story explores themes about the loss of a pet and a pet's desire to take care of their owner.

The team's main goal with this game was to make the player's expreiencee as immersive as possible. To fulfill this goal, player movement and interactions with various objects in the world all emulate the motions of a dog. From a programming perspective, this involved implementing a strong gesture recognition system.

links.linkPretext: You can watch a video of the gameplay

cards.title: Four Paws are Better Than One
cards.description: A fun collaborative game following two friends' as they search for a job

mainRoles.description: Created all collaborative minigames and integrated each player's controls
Implemented system to track player progress and enable story progression
Added a leaderboard to compete with other duos' scores

cards.platform: PC Game made in Unity that uses the DDR Pad and Makey Makey as controllers
cards.longDescription:
Four Paws is a light-hearted collaborative game that follows the story of two friends attempting to find a job they can do together. To prove their collaboration skills, the two go through a series of jobs demonstrating their ability to work together. The gameplay involves having one player play on a DDR mat and the other using a custom two-button controller made with the Makey Makey.

This game was made for the annual ETC Festival, intending to be a fun kid-friendly collaborative game. As such, a lot of consideration was taken to make the game appealing and easy to learn/play.

links.linkPretext: You can watch a video of the gameplay

cards.title: Low Bar
cards.description: An AR game about serving robotic customers in a futuristic bar

mainRoles.description: Created core pouring and mixing interactions for a realistic drink mixing experience
Implemented modular classes to easily create unique orders and customers

cards.platform: Microsoft Hololens AR Game made in Unity
cards.longDescription:
Low Bar is a drink-mixing game set in a futuristic bar utilizing the AR capabilities of the Microsoft Hololens. Players must fulfill orders from robotic customers and serve them the correctly mixed drink/flavoring pairing to suit their tastes.

The main objective of this game was to explore the capabilities of AR, which we did by setting up different gesture recognition systems to enable players to pour and mix drinks. We also kept extendability in mind by setting up a easily customizable system to add new customer types and preferences.

links.linkPretext: You can watch a video of the gameplay

cards.title: Bigger, Badder, Buggier

mainRoles.description: Designed and implemented CPU kart logic, including NavMesh navigation and item usage to ensure competitive feel
Created abstract classes to modularize the process of integrating new items and item interactions for both CPU and human players
Closely collaborated with art team to integrate UI into the game

cards.longDescription:
Bigger, Badder, Buggier was a project for the 53-472 AGS course. The game is inspird by similar cartoon-y racing games like Mario Kart, but with a CMU twist! This project involved taking the original buggy game from last year (which encountered many setbacks due to COVID), and turning it into a complete and fun experience.

 We worked in a large interdisciplinary team over the course of the entire semster. For this project, I worked primarily as a programmer for the CPU buggies, items, and UI.

links.linkPretext: You can learn more about the game and play it
Read our spotlight post on CPU kart logic
Read our spotlight post on powerup items

cards.title: Perspective
cards.description: An HTC Vive game based on anamorphic illusions

mainRoles.description: Pitched initial idea of anamorphic puzzles to fully utilize the capabilities of the HTC Vive
Designed and created all 3D puzzles in Maya along with 2D decorative art in museum
Assisted programmers in using bounding box logic to determine the player's gaze and when the puzzle has been solved

cards.platform: HTC Vive VR Game made in Unity
cards.longDescription:
Perspective is a VR game created for the HTC Vive that focuses on the theme of anamorphic illusions, an interesting art form where objects could be seen depending on the viewer's perspective. One mainstream example of this is OK Go's "The Writing's On the Wall" music video. We chose this theme for our game in order to fully utilize the HTC Vive's capabilities of capturing the player's position and orientation.

 This game was built with an interdisciplinary team of 5 over the course of two weeks. My main roles in this project were designing the puzzles and creating the 3D/2D art assets.

links.linkPretext: You can find a recording of the gameplay

cards.title: Dream Guardian
cards.description: A VR rhythm game about defending the dreams of children

mainRoles.description: Created core pulling interaction with rope by using gesture recognition and manipulating physics systems within Unity
Worked with artists in designing and integrating animations and UI elements

cards.platform: Oculus Quest VR Game made in Unity
cards.longDescription:
Dream Guardian is a VR rhythm game where the player must defend a group of sleeping children from evil dream-eating monsters. The player's main interaction with the game is pulling a rope that triggers a hammer attack to defeat the monsters.

This game was a Round 1 game in the ETC Building Virtual Worlds class and was an exploration of how to create a VR game for the Oculus Quest. Our main goal was to get familiar with the hardware and design an easy-to-learn game for anyone to pick up and play. My main contribution was fine-tuning the core player interaction of rope-pulling to make the game feel satisfying to play.

links.linkPretext: You can watch a video of the gameplay

cards.title: The Olympians
cards.description: A WebGL Olympian dating simulator game
cards.role: Lead Programmer, UI Artist, Sound Designer

mainRoles.description: Implemented dialogue tree logic for each character, along with classes to store player progress with each character
Created and integrated all main UI assets, logic, and animations

cards.longDescription:
The Olympians was a final project for the 53-471 GDPP course. This project involved coming up with creative game ideas related to fable, myths, or folklore, and pitching them to the course instructors, who selected the idea that we developed into a full game. This was our first time working on a dating simulator, and we learned a lot about UI design, story-telling, and time management.

 This game was built with an interdisciplinary team of 5 over the course of four weeks. For this project, I was the lead programmer, UI artist, and sound designer.

links.linkPosttext: ! The default Chrome settings do not allow WebGL games, so this currently works best on other browsers, such as Firefox and Safari.

cards.title: Keys to Happiness
cards.description: A music-based puzzle platformer featuring a melodica player!

mainRoles.description: Created and implemented art assets for title screen, enemy characters, and key UI elements
Assisted programmers with bug-fixing puzzle logic and implementing certain enemy interactions

cards.longDescription:
Keys to Happiness was a project for the 53-471 GDPP course. This project involved creating a creative platformer game with an interdisciplinary team of 5 over the course of four weeks. Our game follows a melodica player protagonist who is mocked for not playing a 'real instrument'. The story follows our protagonist as they travere a dream-esque world, where they must solve music-based puzzles and fight their inner demons.

For this project, I worked primarily as a 2D artist and sound designer, but also helped as a backup programmer.

links.linkPosttext: ! The default Chrome settings do not allow WebGL games, so this currently works best on other browsers, such as Firefox and Safari.

cards.title: Fowl Play
cards.description: A multiplayer basketball game about cheating birds
cards.role: Gameplay + UI Programmer, UI Artist, Sound Designer

mainRoles.description: Created and implemented UI and environmental art assets
Integrated character animations into the game
Created BGM and SFX for title screen

cards.platform: HTML5 Game made in Unity for two handheld controllers
cards.briefDescription: A multiplayer basketball game about cheating birds
cards.longDescription:
Fowl Play was a project for the 53-471 GDPP course. This project had the theme of remaking an existing game - in this case, basketball. The idea of Fowl Play came from wordplay on 'Foul Play' and is based on the idea of cheating birds playing 1v1's.

 We worked in interdisciplinary teams of 6 over the course of three weeks. For this project, I worked primarily as a 2D artist, UI programmer, and backup sound designer.

links.linkPosttext: ! This game does require two controllers (XBox or PS4) to play. The default Chrome settings do not allow WebGL games, so this currently works best on other browsers, such as Firefox and Safari.
